title: Instructional Design and Implementation Methods
description: Methods focused on the planning, structuring, and execution of instructional activities, including curriculum development, classroom interventions, and use of specific pedagogical tools.

title: Assessment and Evaluation Methods
description: Methods related to the creation, validation, statistical evaluation, and analysis of assessment instruments such as tests, surveys, and quizzes to measure student learning and conceptual understanding.

title: Qualitative Research Methods
description: Approaches involving the collection and analysis of qualitative data, such as interviews, thematic analysis, content analysis, and ethnographic observation, to explore perspectives, reasoning, and experiences.

title: Quantitative and Statistical Methods
description: Methods utilizing quantitative data collection and statistical analysis, including experimental design, cluster analysis, social network analysis, and use of statistical tests to analyze research data.

title: Mixed-Methods Research
description: Research methodologies that combine qualitative and quantitative approaches, such as mixed-methods studies involving simulations, coding, and statistical analysis.

title: Longitudinal and Case Study Methods
description: Research designs that involve tracking participants or cohorts over extended periods to study development, change, and identity formation, including longitudinal case studies and cross-sequential designs.

title: Technology and Tool Evaluation Methods
description: Approaches to studying the design, implementation, and impact of educational technologies, simulations, and instructional materials on student learning.

title: Secondary Data Analysis Methods
description: Methods involving the reanalysis of existing datasets. (Note: The component related to 'Theoretical Framework Application' has been removed because applying theoretical frameworks constitutes an interpretive lens rather than an empirical research method.)
